intro: Schoutenia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered schoutenia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by orange, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
